message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI 

This paper discusses security challenges in mobile ad hoc networks (MANETs) and proposes a mechanism for detecting malicious packet dropping attacks based on a trust module on each node. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also deals with issues related to wireless transmission, mobility, and capacity, which are relevant to the sub-category cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The proposed mechanism involves gathering, storing, and exchanging reputation information between nodes, which is related to the sub-category cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also presents simulation results, which are relevant to the sub-category cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the proposed mechanism involves cooperation between nodes, which is related to the sub-category cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
